Package com.example.hotelapplication.controllers

Class ReservationController

java.lang.Object
com.example.hotelapplication.controllers.ReservationController
@RestController @CrossOrigin(originPatterns="http://localhost:3000") @RequestMapping("/reservations") public class ReservationController extends Object
Controller class for handling Reservation-related operations.

  • Method Details

    • getReservations

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<ReservationDTO>> getReservations()
      Retrieves a list of all reservations.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the list of ReservationDTOs and HttpStatus OK.

    • getReservationById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ReservationDTO> getReservationById(@PathVariable("id") UUID reservationId)
      Retrieves a specific reservation by ID.
      Parameters:
      reservationId - The UUID of the reservation to retrieve.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the ReservationDTO if found, otherwise HttpStatus NOT_FOUND.

    • insertReservation

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UUID> insertReservation(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid ReservationDTO reservationDTO)
      Inserts a new reservation into the database.
      Parameters:
      reservationDTO - The ReservationDTO object to be inserted.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the generated UUID for the newly inserted reservation and HttpStatus CREATED, or HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST if insertion fails.

    • updateReservation

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> updateReservation(@PathVariable("id") UUID id, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid ReservationDTO reservationDTO)
      Updates an existing reservation in the database.
      Parameters:
      reservationDTO - The updated ReservationDTO object.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with a success message and HttpStatus OK if update is successful, or HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND if the reservation is not found.

    • deleteReservation

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteReservation(@PathVariable("id") UUID id)
      Deletes a reservation from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - The UUID of the reservation to be deleted.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with a success message and HttpStatus OK if deletion is successful, or HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND if the reservation is not found.
